defs.docs: Holochain Development Kit (HDK)

defs.name: api
defs.docs:
developers! Detailed references and examples can be found here for how to use the
 HDK exposed functions to access powerful Holochain functions.

defs.name: call
defs.value: fn <S> (instance_handle: S, zome_name: S, cap_token: Address, fn_name: S, fn_args: JsonString) -> ZomeApiResult<JsonString>
defs.docs:
Call an exposed function from another zome or another (bridged) instance running
 in the same conductor.
 Arguments for the called function are passed and resturned as `JsonString`.
 # Examples
 Here are two example Zomes, where one performs a `call` into the other.

defs.name: commit_entry
commit_entry_result
defs.docs:
Attempts to commit an entry to your local source chain. The entry
 will have to pass the defined validation rules for that entry type.
 If the entry type is defined as public, will also publish the entry to the DHT.

defs.name: debug
defs.docs:
Prints a string through the stdout of the running Conductor, and also
 writes that string to the logger in the execution context
 # Examples
 ```rust
 # #[macro_use]
 # extern crate hdk;
 # use hdk::error::ZomeApiResult;

entry_address
get_entry
get_entry_initial
defs.docs:
Returns the Entry at the exact address specified, whatever its status.
 Returns None if no entry exists at the specified address.

defs.name: get_entry_history
defs.docs:
Return an EntryHistory filled with all the versions of the entry from the version at
 the specified address to the latest.
 Returns None if no entry exists at the specified address.

defs.name: get_entry_result
defs.docs:
Retrieves an entry and its metadata from the local chain or the DHT, by looking it up using
 the specified address.
 The data returned is configurable with the GetEntryOptions argument.

defs.name: keystore_new_random
defs.docs: Creates a new random "root" Seed secret in the keystore

defs.name: keystore_derive_seed
defs.value: fn <S> (src_id: S, dst_id: S, context: S, index: u64) -> ZomeApiResult<()>
defs.docs:
Creates a new derived seed secret in the keystore, derived from a previously defined seed.
 Accepts two arguments: the keystore ID of the previously defined seed, and a keystore ID for the newly derived seed.

defs.name: keystore_derive_key
defs.value: fn <S> (src_id: S, dst_id: S, key_type: KeyType) -> ZomeApiResult<String>
defs.docs:
Creates a new derived key secret in the keystore derived from on a previously defined seed.
 Accepts two arguments: the keystore ID of the previously defined seed, and a keystore ID for the newly derived key.

defs.name: keystore_sign
defs.docs:
Signs a payload using a private key from the keystore.
 Accepts one argument: the keystore ID of the desired private key.

defs.name: keystore_get_public_key
defs.docs:
Returns the public key of a key secret
 Accepts one argument: the keystore ID of the desired public key.
 Fails if the id is a Seed secret.

defs.name: link_entries
defs.value: fn <S> (base: &Address, target: &Address, link_type: S, tag: S) -> Result<Address, ZomeApiError>
defs.docs:
Adds a named, tagged, directed link between two entries on the DHT.
 Consumes four values, two of which are the addresses of entries, and two of which are strings used to describe the link.

defs.name: query
defs.value: fn (entry_type_names: QueryArgsNames, start: usize, limit: usize) -> ZomeApiResult<Vec<Address>>
defs.docs: Returns a list of entries from your local source chain that match a given entry type name or names.

defs.name: remove_link
defs.value: fn <S> (base: &Address, target: &Address, link_type: S, tag: S) -> Result<(), ZomeApiError>

defs.name: send
defs.value: fn (to_agent: Address, payload: String, timeout: Timeout) -> ZomeApiResult<String>
defs.docs:
Sends a node-to-node message to the given agent, specified by their address.
 Addresses of agents can be accessed using [hdk::AGENT_ADDRESS](struct.AGENT_ADDRESS.html).
 This works in conjunction with the `receive` callback that has to be defined in the
 [define_zome!](../macro.define_zome.html) macro.

defs.name: sign
sign_one_time
verify_signature
sleep
update_entry
defs.docs:
Commit an entry to your local source chain that "updates" a previous entry, meaning when getting
 the previous entry, the updated entry will be returned.
 `update_entry` sets the previous entry's status metadata to `Modified` and adds the updated
 entry's address in the previous entry's metadata.
 The updated entry will hold the previous entry's address in its header,
 which will be used by validation routes.

defs.name: update_agent
defs.docs: NOT YET AVAILABLE

defs.name: remove_entry
defs.docs:
Commit a DeletionEntry to your local source chain that marks an entry as 'deleted' by setting
 its status metadata to `Deleted` and adding the DeleteEntry's address in the deleted entry's
 metadata, which will be used by validation routes.

defs.name: version
defs.docs: this method will return the current version of the HDK based on the latest git tag

defs.name: G_MEM_STACK
defs.docs: Internal global for memory usage

defs.name: DNA_NAME
defs.docs: The `name` property as taken from the DNA.

defs.name: DNA_ADDRESS
defs.docs:
The address of the DNA the Zome is embedded within.
 This is often useful as a fixed value that is known by all
 participants running the DNA.

defs.name: AGENT_ID_STR
defs.docs: The identity string used when the chain was first initialized.

defs.name: AGENT_ADDRESS
defs.docs:
The hash of your public key.
 This is your node address on the DHT.
 It can be used for node-to-node messaging with `send` and `receive` functions.

defs.name: AGENT_INITIAL_HASH
defs.docs:
The hash of the first identity entry on your chain (The second entry on your chain).
 This is your peer's identity on the DHT.

defs.name: AGENT_LATEST_HASH
defs.docs:
The hash of the most recent identity entry that has been committed to your chain.
 Starts with the same value as AGENT_INITIAL_HASH.
 After a call to `update_agent` it will have the value of the hash of the newly committed identity entry.

defs.name: PUBLIC_TOKEN
defs.docs: The Address of the public token (if any)

defs.name: CAPABILITY_REQ
defs.docs: The CapabilityRequest under which this wasm function is executing

defs.docs:
The json string from the DNA top level properties field.
 Deserialize this into a serde_json::Value or a zome specific struct to access the fields

defs.name: get_links_and_load_type
defs.value: fn <R> (base: &Address, link_type: LinkMatch<&str>, tag: LinkMatch<&str>) -> ZomeApiResult<Vec<R>>
defs.docs:
Helper function that perfoms a try_from for every entry
 of a get_links_and_load for a given type. Any entries that either fail to
 load or cannot be converted to the type will be dropped.

Creates two links:
 From A to B, and from B to A, with given link_types.

defs.name: commit_and_link
defs.value: fn <S> (entry: &Entry, base: &Address, link_type: S, tag: S) -> ZomeApiResult<Address>
defs.docs:
Commits the given entry and links it from the base
 with the given link_type.

defs.name: entry_definition
defs.docs:
This file contains the macros used for creating validating entry type definitions,
 and validating links definitions within those.

defs.name: ValidatingEntryType
defs.value: ValidatingEntryType { name, entry_type_definition, package_creator, validator, links }
defs.docs:
This struct represents a complete entry type definition.
 It wraps [EntryTypeDef](holochain_core_types::dna::entry_types::EntryTypeDef) defined in the DNA crate
 which only represents the static parts that show up in the JSON definition
 of an entry type.
 What is missing from there is the validation callbacks that can not be defined as JSON
 and are added here as Box<FnMut> objects (types PackageCreator, Validator, LinkValidator)

defs.name: name
defs.docs: Name of the entry type

defs.name: entry_type_definition
defs.docs: All the static aspects of the entry type as

defs.name: package_creator
defs.docs:
Callback that returns a validation package definition that Holochain reads in order
 to create the right validation package to pass in to the validator callback on validation.

defs.name: validator
defs.docs: This is the validation callback that is used to determine if an entry is valid.

defs.name: ValidatingLinkDefinition
defs.value: ValidatingLinkDefinition { direction, other_entry_type, link_type, package_creator, validator }
defs.docs:
Similar to ValidatingEntryType, this provides the dynamic aspects of link definitions,
 the validation callbacks, and thus completes the structs in the DNA crate.
 The [entry! macro](entry!) expects an array of links that are represented by
 instances of this struct.

defs.name: direction
defs.docs:
Is this link defined as pointing from this entry type to some other type,
 or from the other type to this?

defs.name: other_entry_type
defs.docs: The other entry type the link connects this entry type to

defs.name: link_type
defs.docs: Tag (i.e. name) of this type of links

defs.name: package_creator
defs.docs:
Callback that returns a validation package definition that Holochain reads in order
 to create the right validation package to pass in to the validator callback on validation.

defs.name: validator
defs.docs: This is the validation callback that is used to determine if a link is valid.

defs.name: ZomeApiError
defs.docs:
Error for DNA developers to use in their Zome code.
 This does not have to be sent back to Ribosome unless its an InternalError.

defs.name: init_globals
defs.docs:
Holds the internal/private zome API function `init_globals`
 which initializes the Zome API Globals with the values it receives from the Ribosome.
 It is automatically called at startup of each Zome function call.

defs.name: macros
defs.docs: This file contains the define_zome! macro, and smaller helper macros.

defs.name: meta
defs.docs:
This file contains the "secret" functions that get added to Zomes, by the HDK.  These functions match expectations that Holochain has... every Zome technically needs these functions,
 but not every developer should have to write them. A notable function defined here is
 __hdk_get_json_definition which allows Holochain to retrieve JSON defining the Zome.
